MATH Short Answer What is the largest number of sides possible for a regular polygon that 
tessellates the plane?
bonusQ:

is the area, in square feet, of the triangle in simplest radical form?

LIFE SCIENCE Short Answer Besides xylem and phloem (read as: FLŌE-ehm), what is the 
third tissue layer that comprises the stele in eudicot roots?
bonusQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Short Answer Give the common names of two of the principal species of 
Pacific salmon.
bonusA:
(ACCEPT TWO) SOCKEYE, CHUM, COASTAL CUTTHROAT TROUT, CHINOOK, 
COHO, STEELHEAD, OR PINK

tossupQ:
ENERGY Short Answer What is the term for the minimum amount of fissile material required 
for a chain reaction to be self-sustaining?
bonusQ:
ENERGY Short Answer What is the name of a device which consists of dissimilar metals 
joined together at one end that is used as a sensor for measuring temperature?

tossupQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice The mechanical advantage of a block and tackle 
depends on which of the following? 
 
W) The size of the rope 
X) The length of the rope 
Y) The diameter of the wheels 
Z) The number of sections of rope
tossupA: Z) THE NUMBER OF SECTIONS OF ROPE
bonusQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following situations produces the MOST 
power? 
 
W) 160 newton force acting over 20 meters in 32 seconds 
X) 160 newton force acting over 2 meters in 3.2 seconds 
Y) 16 newton force acting over 20 meters in 3.2 seconds 
Z) 16 newton force acting over 200 meters in 3.2 seconds
bonusA: Z) 16 NEWTON FORCE ACTING OVER 200 METERS IN 3.2 SECONDS

tossupQ: LIFE SCIENCE Short Answer Give the class of mollusks in which squid would be classified.
bonusQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Unlike other mollusks , cephalopods (read as: SEH-fah-loh-
pohds) have which of the following characteristics? 
 
W) Gills 
X) Radula 
Y) Open circulatory system 
Z) Closed circulatory system

tossupQ:
MATH Multiple Choice Assuming that all of the following two dimensional shapes have the 
same area, which has the least perimeter? 
 
W) Triangle 
X) Circle 
Y) Trapezoid 
Z) Square
bonusQ:
MATH Short Answer At a special showing of “The Magic Flute,” all 300 tickets were sold for 
a total of $5,360. If an adult ticket was $20 and a youth ticket was $12, how many adult tickets 
were sold?

tossupQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice For a certain genetic disorder in humans, the mother 
always passes the disease to all of her children, but a father never passes it to any of his 
children. Which of the following explanations best explains this phenomenon? 
 
W) The gene for the disease is located on the X-chromosome 
X) The gene is dominant and is located on an autosomal chromosome 
Y) The gene is located on ribosomal (read as: RY-boh-sōem-ahl) DNA 
Z) The gene is located on mitochondrial (read as: my-toh-KOHN-dree-ahl) DNA
tossupA: Z) THE GENE IS LOCATED ON MITOCHONDRIAL DNA
bonusQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Short Answer What is the most stable isotope of rutherfordium (read 
as: ruh-the(r)-FOHR-dee-uhm)?

when magma is torn apart by volcanic eruptions?
bonusQ:

launched in 2001, that orbited Mars to measure elements in its crust and search for signs of 
water?

tossupQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice Sediment with a diameter between 2 millimeters and 
4 millimeters would be classified as which of the following? 
 
W) Silt 
X) Coarse sand 
Y) Medium sand 
Z) Cobble
bonusQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Short Answer When a free neutron undergoes beta decay, what three 
particles does it form?
bonusA:
ELECTRON, PROTON, AND ELECTRON ANTINEUTRINO (DO NOT ACCEPT: 
ELECTRON NEUTRINO)

tossupQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following is the most likely effect on the 
remaining bacteria after killing 90% of bacteria with antibacterial soap? 
 
W) They will reproduce and form a colony of bacteria that are more resistant 
X) They will die because there are not enough bacteria left to reproduce 
Y) They will relocate 
Z) They can no longer cause infections because their numbers are too low
tossupA:
W) THEY WILL REPRODUCE AND FORM A COLONY OF BACTERIA THAT ARE 
MORE RESISTANT
bonusQ:
LIFE SCIENCE Short Answer Give the scientific names of the three small bones found in 
the human ear.

tossupQ:

cannonball jellyfish? 
 
W) They can make up more than 16% of biomass in shallow inshore areas off the southeastern 
coast of the United States 
X) They commonly sting humans 
Y) One of their main predators is the leatherback sea turtle 
Z) They can reproduce both sexually and asexually

GENERAL SCIENCE Short Answer What is the genus of the oldest known vertebrate to 
show viviparity (read as: vy-vi-PAH-rit-ee)?

MATH Short Answer Evaluate: 10!/(8!3!)
 (read as: 10 factorial over the quantity 8 factorial times 
3 factorial).
bonusQ:
MATH Short Answer Harry bought a shirt that was marked 50% off the sale price, which 
was 40% off the original price. Providing your answer as a decimal to the nearest tenth, after 
paying a tax of 8%, what percent of the original sticker price did he pay?

tossupQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice In a transverse wave, the medium vibrates in which 
of the following ways? 
 
W) In a direction opposite the wave direction 
X) At right angles to the wave direction 
Y) In the same direction as the wave 
Z) At a 45 degree angle to the wave direction
tossupA: X) AT RIGHT ANGLES TO THE WAVE DIRECTION
bonusQ: PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer Name three ferromagnetic elements.
bonusA:
(ACCEPT THREE) IRON, NICKEL, COBALT, DYSPROSIUM, PLUTONIUM, AND 
GADOLINIUM
